revision.comment: clean up; page → pages; replaced hyphen with n-dash using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox military structure |name=Firebase Russell |partof= |location= |coordinates={{Coord|16|48|07|N|106|48|45|E|display=inline|name=Firebase Russell}} |image= |caption= |type= Marines |code= |built= 1968 |builder= |materials= |height= |used= 1968-9 |demolished= |condition=abandoned |ownership= |controlledby= |garrison= |commanders= |occupants= [[3rd Marine Division (United States)|3rd Marine Division]] |battles= [[File:Vietnam Service Ribbon.svg|60px]]
[[Vietnam War]] |events= }} '''Firebase Russell''' (also known as '''FSB Russell''' and '''LZ Russell''') is a former U.S. Marine Corps base northwest of [[The Rockpile]] in [[Quảng Trị Province]], [[Vietnam]]. ==History== The base was originally established in December 1968 by the [[1st Battalion 4th Marines]] approximately 3 km northwest of The Rockpile and just south of the [[Vietnamese Demilitarized Zone|DMZ]].{{cite book|last=Kelley|first=Michael|title=Where we were in Vietnam|publisher=Hellgate Press|year=2002|isbn=978-1555716257|pages=5–541}} On the morning of 25 February 1969 sappers from the 27th NVA Regiment attacked FSB Russell killing 27 Marines from the [[2nd Battalion 4th Marines]] and [[3rd Battalion 12th Marines]] and 2 Navy corpsmen. On the same morning the North Vietnamese also attacked [[Firebase Neville]] 10 km west of FSB Russell killing 14 Marines and Corpsmen.{{cite web|url=https://www.mca-marines.org/mcaf-blog/2012/02/15/25-february-1969-fire-support-bases-neville-and-russell|title=25 February 1969-Fire Support Bases Neville and Russell|publisher=Marine Corps Association|accessdate=5 November 2014}}{{cite book|last=Smith|first=Charles|title=U.S. Marines in Vietnam High Mobility and Standdown 1969|publisher=History and Museums Division HQ US Marine Corps|year=1988|isbn=|pages=22–3}} ==Current use== The base is abandoned and has reverted to jungle. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Marine Corps}} ==External links== *http://www.lzrussell.org/pictures/russell.htm pictures of Firebase Russell [[Category:Defunct United States Marine Corps facilities]] [[Category:Military bases of the Vietnam War]] [[Category:United States military bases of the Vietnam War]] {{military-stub}}
